fork.tines: - Tines - The long, thin, pointed prongs at the end of the fork used for piercing, lifting, and holding food.
fork.head: - Head - The upper flat section of the fork that holds the tines together and is used to slide under and lift food.
fork.edge: - Edge - The side of the tines which can be used for scraping actions.
fork.prongs: - Prongs - Another term for tines, which are sharp enough to impale food effectively.
fork.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of each tine designed to penetrate into items.
fork.neck: - Neck - The narrow section connecting the handle to the head of the fork, providing leverage for prying.

spoon.bowl: - Bowl - The rounded, curved, concave part of the spoon used for scooping, lifting, pressing, scraping, spreading, and prying substances.
spoon.tip: - Tip - The pointed end of the spoon's bowl opposite the handle, used for piercing, sliding under, or lifting substances.
spoon.back: - Back - The flat, outer surface of the spoon bowl, used for pressing or spreading substances.
spoon.edge: - Edge - The rim of the spoon's bowl, useful for scraping off materials.

screwdriver.shaft: - Shaft - The long, cylindrical metal part extending from the handle to the tip, providing leverage and used for scraping or poking.
screwdriver.tip: - Tip - The narrow, pointed or flat end of the screwdriver used for inserting into screw heads.
screwdriver.blade: - Blade - The flat, narrow part extending from the handle to the tip, which can also be used for piercing if it is thin and sturdy enough.

pan.base: - Base - The flat bottom part of the pan that comes into contact with the heat source and is used for cooking.
pan.rim: - Rim - The upper edge of the pan, which can be used to scoop.
pan.lip: - Lip - The rim or edge of the pan that curves slightly outward for controlled pouring.
pan.spout: - Spout - A specially designed notch or extension on the rim to facilitate pouring without dripping.
pan.side: - Side - The vertical or slightly sloped surfaces extending from the base to the rim, which can also be used for pounding.

measuring_cup.base: - Base - The bottom surface of the measuring cup, which can be pressed against a surface.
measuring_cup.bowl: - Bowl - The open, hollow part of the measuring cup used to contain and scoop materials.
measuring_cup.rim: - Rim - The edge of the bowl that helps in leveling off the scooped materials.
measuring_cup.spout: - Spout - The protruding part at the rim, shaped specifically to direct the flow of liquids.
measuring_cup.lip: - Lip - The edge of the cup's rim that helps control the pour when a spout is not present.

mug.base: - Base - The flat bottom part of the mug that makes contact with surfaces.
mug.rim: - Rim - The upper edge of the mug from which liquids are poured and materials can be scooped.
mug.mouth: - Mouth - The opening at the top of the mug from which beverages are poured.
mug.body: - Body - The cylindrical or slightly tapered main part of the mug where drinks are held.

pot.base: - Base - The flat, sturdy bottom of the pot, used for stability and to make contact with surfaces.
pot.rim: - Rim - The upper edge of the pot, which can scoop up materials when tilted.
pot.side: - Side - The cylindrical outer surface of the pot, which can be used to strike against items.

ladle.bowl: - Bowl - The deep, curved part of the ladle used to scoop, hold, and pour liquids or solids.
ladle.base: - Base - The bottom surface of the bowl, which can be pressed against a surface.
ladle.lip: - Lip - The edge or rim of the bowl that directs the flow of liquid when pouring.

spatula.blade: - Blade - The wide, flat, flexible part used for flipping, spreading, scraping, and lifting items.
spatula.surface: - Surface - The flat face of the blade that contacts, presses against, and lifts food items.
spatula.edge: - Edge - The thin side of the blade useful for scraping off materials.
spatula.head: - Head - The broad, slightly curved end of the spatula used to apply and spread materials.
spatula.tip: - Tip - The edge of the blade that can be inserted to pry open containers.

strainer.rim: - Rim - The firm edge around the top of the strainer's bowl that helps maintain its shape.
strainer.mesh: - Mesh - Fine net-like material that separates solids from liquids, forming the body of the strainer.

hammer.claw: - Claw - The split, curved, forked part at the back of the hammer head, used for pulling nails and prying objects.
hammer.edge: - Edge - The side or end of the hammer head that can be utilized to scrape surfaces.
hammer.head: - Head - The solid, heavy metal part at the top of the hammer used for striking, pulling nails, and prying against surfaces.
hammer.face: - Face - The flat end of the head, which directly contacts nails or other materials to pound them.

fixed_joint_pliers.jaws: - Jaws - The metal tips on the pliers used to grasp or exert pressure on objects, capable of piercing if narrow.
fixed_joint_pliers.teeth: - Teeth - The serrated surfaces within the jaws that grip and can pierce into items forcefully.
fixed_joint_pliers.tips: - Tips - The pointed ends of the plier's jaws, which can be used to poke into small spaces or items.

ratchet.head: - Head - The component of the ratchet that houses the mechanism for socket attachment and facilitates the pull action.
ratchet.pawl: - Pawl - The small, clickable mechanism inside the head that engages with the gear to apply the pulling force.
